snippet: The lesson of Roe v. Wade is that the Supreme Court must not wait on fundamental rights.
abstract: Editorial rejects Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg's view  that court's Roe v Wade decision 'moved too far, too fast'; warns overblown fears of backlash based on false reading of politics before and after Roe v Wade could lead Supreme Court to shy away from enforcing equal protection by declaring same-sex marriage constitutionally protected right in every state.
lead_paragraph: The lesson of Roe v. Wade is that the Supreme Court must not wait on fundamental rights.

headline.seo: Justice Ginsburg’s Misdirection Ahead of the Gay Marriage Rulings

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
